Gordon Mohr (Internet Archive) writes:
> Thanks for the report; I presume you're using very recent CVS HEAD code?

Yes --- updated 2004/07/20 around 16h00 or so.

[...]
> I see you're running with a non-default 'valence'; that's probably the trigger.

Ah, that makes sense, since this happened a week or two ago with
another crawl (larger seed list) where I used a valence > 1.

> Please file a bug, especially if your initial settings and seeds trigger the
> problem every time.

It looks like they do. I'll do a run with assertions and see what happens.

> It would also be interesting to try triggering the bug with with assertions
> enabled ('-ea' VM arg), because that may catch the root cause earlier.
> 
> I suspect it can't be reproduced at all with valence = 1.

Thanks Gordon.

    -tree
